page.title: 06C l a x t o n C a s t l e.
page.content: Today only the south face of the castle remains,in the shape of a massive wall with its 6 bastions between 120-130ft long,with an isolated pier about 20 yards to the north-west.This pier is probably part of the East face and the entrance gateway.What looks like portcullis grooves can still be seen in the brickwork.The south and west walls have gone altogether.The north side of the existing wall clearly shows the probable position of the great hall and various other rooms.Doorways still show in the flanking towers where they lead to upper and lower storeys.The wall however is not pierced by windows.Evidently the rooms were lighted from the inner courtyard. Traces of a deep moat around the whole building can still be seen,whilst a four acre pasture to the North.
